Package io.github.eutro.wasm2j.core.util

Class IRUtils

java.lang.Object
io.github.eutro.wasm2j.core.util.IRUtils
public class IRUtils extends Object
A set of utilities for working with Wasm2j's IR.

  • Method Details

    • getThis

      public static Var getThis(IRBuilder ib)
      Insert an instruction to get the implicit Java receiver in an instance method, this.
      Parameters:
      ib - The instruction builder.
      Returns:
      The loaded this.

    • loadClass

      public static Insn loadClass(Type ty)
      Get the instruction for loading the class described by the given type.
      Parameters:
      ty - The type.
      Returns:
      The instruction to load the class for ty.

    • getAddr

      public static Var getAddr(IRBuilder ib, WasmOps.WithMemArg<?> wmArg, Var ptr)
      Get the instruction which computes the offset address of an instruction.
      Parameters:
      ib - The instruction builder.
      wmArg - The argument containing the offset.
      ptr - The un-offset pointer.
      Returns:
      The offset pointer.

    • lenLoop

      public static void lenLoop(IRBuilder ib, Var[] toInc, boolean invert, Var len, Consumer<Var[]> f)
      Create a loop. This API should not be considered stable.
      Parameters:
      ib - The instruction builder.
      toInc - The list of loop variables.
      invert - True if loop variables should be decremented, false if they should be incremented.
      len - The number of iterations.
      f - The function creating the loop body, given an array of the loop variables. This will include all of toInc (incremented as appropriate), and a single variable which will go from 0 to len.

    • emitNullableInt

      public static Var emitNullableInt(IRBuilder ib, @Nullable @Nullable Integer num)
      Emit a boxed integer, possibly null.
      Parameters:
      ib - The instruction builder.
      num - The integer.
      Returns:
      The loaded boxed integer.

    • fillAuto

      public static void fillAuto(byte[] data, IRBuilder ib, Var dataV)
      Emit code to fill a byte buffer with static data.
      Parameters:
      data - The data.
      ib - The instruction builder.
      dataV - The byte buffer.

    • fillWithDirectPuts

      public static void fillWithDirectPuts(byte[] data, IRBuilder ib, Var dataV)
      Emit code to fill a byte buffer with static data using direct ByteBuffer.put(byte) and ByteBuffer.putShort(short) calls.

      This may emit a method too large if the static data is too long.

      Parameters:
      data - The data.
      ib - The instruction builder.
      dataV - The byte buffer.

    • fillWithBase64

      public static void fillWithBase64(byte[] data, IRBuilder ib, Var dataV)
      Emit code to fill a byte buffer with static data using gzipped-base64 strings.

      This will be able to embed more data than fillWithDirectPuts(byte[], IRBuilder, Var), and will split the string to create constants short enough for the constant pool. It still cannot embed unbounded data, but we can't do much better.

      Parameters:
      data - The data.
      ib - The instruction builder.
      dataV - The byte buffer.

    • emitFill

      public static <T> void emitFill(IRBuilder ib, Effect effect, UnaryOpKey<Integer> key, IRUtils.StoreOrLoadFn store, T t, IRUtils.BoundsCheckFn<T> emitBoundsCheck)
      Not stable.

    • emitCopy

      public static <T> void emitCopy(IRBuilder ib, Effect effect, UnaryOpKey<Pair<Integer,Integer>> key, IRUtils.StoreOrLoadFn load, IRUtils.StoreOrLoadFn store, T srcT, T dstT, IRUtils.BoundsCheckFn<T> emitBoundsCheck)
      Not stable.

    • trapWhen

      public static void trapWhen(IRBuilder ib, Insn insn, String msg)
      Emit code to trap with the given message if a given instruction jumps.
      Parameters:
      ib - The instruction builder.
      insn - The jump instruction.
      msg - The message.
